results.abstract: In a year of tragedy and isolation, screens were more important than ever before. These film, TV and TikTok stars gave us more than just diversion.
results.byline: By Wesley Morris and A.O. Scott
results.title: The Best Actors of 2020
When Culture Really Began to Reckon With White Privilege
results.abstract: Black artists didn’t wait around for institutional change. They are making it happen.

results.title: ‘Small Axe’ Review: The Agonies and Ecstasies of Black British Lives
results.abstract: Steve McQueen’s anthology of five films is a revelatory look at Afro-Caribbean neighborhoods in Britain from the 1960s to the ’80s.

results.abstract: The screening rooms were closed. The festivals were virtual. The blockbusters were in storage. Even so, our critics found abundant and inspiring signs of cinematic life in the pandemic.

results.title: Tommy Lister, Actor Who Menaced as Deebo in ‘Friday,’ Is Dead at 62

results.title: The Biggest Casting News From Disney’s Investor Day
results.abstract: “Black Panther 2” will not recast King T’Challa. Harrison Ford is picking up the hat and whip again. And “Star Wars” recruited Rosario Dawson for her own show.
